predictions.text: Coursera and Udemy will close (consummate) their announced merger transaction by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if both companies (or the surviving entity) announce deal completion via press release and/or SEC filing (8-K, 6-K) dated on or before 2026-09-30 UTC; NO otherwise.
evidence: TechCrunch reports Coursera agreed to combine with Udemy (~$2.5B), implying a signed merger agreement and typical multi-month close timeline: https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/17/coursera-and-udemy-enter-a-merger-agreement-valued-at-around-2-5b/
monitoring_signals: HSR/antitrust second-request announcements or early termination notices
Coursera/Udemy 8-K filings on shareholder votes and regulatory clearances
Material adverse effect disclosures or deal amendment press releases
predictions.rationale: Signed public merger agreements commonly close within 6–12 months, but education-platform overlap could trigger regulatory or shareholder delays.

predictions.text: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission will file a formal complaint (federal court or administrative) or announce a settlement/order against Instacart related to algorithmic/AI pricing practices by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the FTC publicly posts or announces (press release, docket, or federal court filing) a complaint and/or settlement/order naming Instacart and primarily concerning algorithmic/AI pricing; must be dated on or before 2026-06-30 UTC.
evidence: CNBC notes FTC scrutiny of an AI pricing tool, increasing odds of escalation beyond inquiry: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/17/instacart-sec-probe-pricing-tool.html
monitoring_signals: FTC press releases mentioning Instacart, pricing algorithms, or unfair/deceptive pricing
PACER filings with FTC as plaintiff vs Instacart
Instacart disclosures about CIDs, subpoenas, or settlement talks in filings/press
predictions.rationale: Regulators are increasingly focused on algorithmic price discrimination, but many probes end without a public complaint or settle after longer timelines.

predictions.text: Coinbase will launch U.S. retail-accessible stock trading (ability for U.S.-based retail customers to place orders for U.S.-listed equities) by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Coinbase publicly announces U.S. retail availability of stock trading (not just beta/waitlist) and the feature is accessible in the Coinbase app/site for U.S. retail users by 2026-06-30 UTC; NO otherwise.
evidence: CNBC reports Coinbase adds prediction markets and stock trading, indicating active product build and regulatory/operational readiness efforts: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/17/coinbase-prediction-markets-stock-trading-stablecoins.html
monitoring_signals: Coinbase product announcements and updated fee schedules for equities
Broker-dealer/clearing partnerships disclosed by Coinbase
App store release notes and U.S. user enablement confirmations
predictions.rationale: Coinbase is expanding toward full-service brokerage, but U.S. equities require licensing/partners and could slip if regulators or infrastructure timelines extend.

predictions.text: Micron will report quarterly revenue of at least $9.0B in at least one earnings release issued by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any Micron quarterly earnings press release dated on or before 2026-06-30 UTC reports GAAP (or non-GAAP, as presented as total revenue) revenue >= $9.0B for the reported quarter; NO otherwise.
evidence: CNBC reports Micron forecasting surging revenue as AI-driven memory demand stays strong: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/17/micron-q1-earnings-forecast-memory-demand-ai.html
monitoring_signals: DRAM/NAND spot and contract pricing indices
Hyperscaler capex guidance updates
Micron earnings pre-announcements and segment commentary (HBM, data center)
predictions.rationale: AI memory demand and HBM ramp raise the chance of a $9B+ quarter, though cyclicality and supply additions remain key downside risks.

predictions.text: Oracle will publicly announce a new external financing partner or co-investor for its Michigan (formerly reported ~$10B) data center project by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Oracle (or the project entity) issues a press release, investor presentation, or SEC filing naming a new financing partner/co-investor explicitly tied to the Michigan data center project, dated on or before 2026-06-30 UTC.
evidence: CNBC reports Oracle shares dropped after Blue Owl exited funding a $10B data center, implying a need to reconstitute financing: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/17/oracle-stock-blue-owl-michigan-data-center.html
monitoring_signals: Oracle capex guidance changes and data center buildout commentary
Infrastructure fund announcements referencing Michigan/Oracle
Local permitting/utility filings showing continued build vs pause
predictions.rationale: Large AI-infrastructure projects often repackage financing after a partner exits, but higher rates and tighter underwriting could delay or shrink the deal.

predictions.text: Freddie Mac PMMS 30-year fixed mortgage rate will print at or above 7.00% in at least one weekly survey by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any Freddie Mac Primary Mortgage Market Survey (PMMS) weekly release dated on or before 2026-03-31 UTC reports the 30-year fixed rate >= 7.00%.
evidence: CNBC highlights mortgage rates rose even after a Fed cut, pointing to term premium/credit spread dynamics: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/17/mortgage-rates-moved-higher-after-fed-rate-cut.html
monitoring_signals: 10-year Treasury yield and MBS current-coupon spreads
Weekly PMMS prints and Mortgage News Daily rate tracking
Bank funding stress and mortgage originator margin changes
predictions.rationale: If term premium or MBS spreads widen, mortgage rates can rise despite policy easing, but a growth scare or rally in long rates would counteract.

predictions.text: ICE Brent crude oil front-month futures will settle at or above $85.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the official ICE Brent front-month settlement price is >= $85.00 on any trading day with settlement date on or before 2026-03-31 UTC (per ICE settlement data).
evidence: CNBC reports U.S. action targeting Venezuelan oil tankers and escorting by Venezuela, highlighting supply-disruption risk: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/17/crude-oil-prices-today.html
monitoring_signals: Announced enforcement actions affecting Venezuelan exports
OPEC+ policy shifts and compliance data
OECD inventory levels and prompt time-spread steepening
predictions.rationale: Geopolitical supply risks can produce sharp price spikes, but weak demand or spare capacity offsets keep the probability below 50% over this horizon.

predictions.text: Statistics Canada will report another quarter of negative population growth (quarter-over-quarter change < 0) in an official release published by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any official Statistics Canada quarterly population estimates release published on or before 2026-06-30 UTC shows total population Q/Q change < 0 for the reported quarter; NO otherwise.
evidence: NYT reports Canada’s population declines amid tightened immigration, suggesting potential persistence if policies remain restrictive: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/17/world/canada/canada-population-decline-immigration.html
monitoring_signals: Immigration admissions and visa policy updates
Quarterly net international migration estimates
Labor market and housing indicators that influence policy reversals
predictions.rationale: A continued policy-driven drop is plausible, but Canada can quickly reverse trends via visa/permit adjustments, making persistence uncertain.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Loan Programs Office (or another DOE financing vehicle) will announce a conditional commitment or finalized loan guarantee totaling at least $2.0B for a nuclear power project in the U.S. by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if DOE publicly announces (press release or official statement) a conditional commitment and/or closed loan/guarantee with stated total amount >= $2.0B for a U.S. nuclear generation project (including SMR) dated on or before 2026-12-31 UTC.
evidence: IEEE Spectrum describes U.S. plans for the largest nuclear buildout since the 1970s, implying financing mechanisms will be activated: https://spectrum.ieee.org/80-billion-us-nuclear-power
monitoring_signals: DOE/LPO solicitation updates and application pipeline disclosures
Utility announcements of SMR/new-build milestones (COL, EPC awards)
Congressional appropriations/credit subsidy changes affecting LPO capacity
predictions.rationale: Ambitious buildout plans increase financing odds, but permitting, offtake, and cost-overrun concerns often slow commitments and reduce deal sizes.
